triples.name: Bantu languages
triples.relevance: The paper studies emphatic interpretations across various Bantu languages including Lubukusu and Cinyungwe.

triples.name: Differential object marking
triples.relevance: The core phenomenon being analyzed is object marking doubling and its emphatic interpretations in Bantu languages.

triples.name: Focus (linguistics)
triples.relevance: The paper discusses emphatic interpretations arising from focus fronting in Indo-European languages as a parallel phenomenon.

triples.name: Implicature
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes emphatic interpretations of object marking as conventional implicatures following recent semantic theory.

triples.name: Bukusu dialect
triples.relevance: Lubukusu is the Bukusu dialect of the Masaba language spoken in Kenya, one of the primary languages studied.

triples.name: Nyungwe language
triples.relevance: Cinyungwe (Nyungwe) is a Bantu language of Mozambique, one of the primary languages studied in the paper.

triples.name: Pragmatics
triples.relevance: The paper proposes novel strategies for identifying and analyzing emphatic interpretations as pragmatic phenomena tied to conventional implicatures in Bantu languages.
